Setup the API Key

Source: vignettes/Setup.Rmd
Setup.Rmd

Instructions for the first-time use of the STATcube REST API.

Adding an API key

In order to use the REST API of STATcube it is necessary to provide an API key. If your STATcube account is configured to use a key, the following address can be used to view your key

http://sdbext:8081/statistik.at/ext/statcube/jsf/preferences/editPreferences.xhtml

To make the key available to STATcubeR, use the function sc_key_set(). Replace "XXXX" with your key.

sc_key_set("XXXX")
#> The provided key will be available for this R session. Add
#>
#>   STATCUBE_KEY=XXXX
#>
#> to your .Renviron to set the key persistently

As suggested by the code output, the key can be set persistently by modifying .Renviron. This can be done easily with usethis::edit_r_environ().

How do I get an API key?

Currently, the api is only available inside the firewall of statistics austria. Therefore, api keys can only be requested by our employees. Api access for external users with a statcube subscription is planned in the near future. Please get into contact with the package maintainers of STATcubeR for details.

Next Steps

See the JSON requests article to see how tables can be defined in the STATcube GUI and imported into R. Alternatively, import a saved table by following the saved tables article
